title: Latin America: Citi Recognized by Global Finance with 26 Awards for "World's Best Internet Banks in Latin America 2011"
summary: Miami, Fla. - Citi announced today that it has won 26 awards in the first round of Global Finance magazine's World's Best Internet Banks in Latin America 2011 competition, including eight of eight in the regional sub-category awards and 18 country awards in the Best Corporate/Institutional Internet Banks category.
tag-1: Latin America: Citi Recognized by Global Finance with 26 Awards for "World's Best Internet Banks in Latin America 2011"
tag-3: Miami, Fla. – Citi announced today that it has won 26 awards in the first round of Global Finance magazine's World's Best Internet Banks in Latin America 2011 competition, including eight of eight in the regional sub-category awards and 18 country awards in the Best Corporate/Institutional Internet Banks category.
tag-4: Citi Latin America earned six awards in the regional sub-category of Best Corporate/Institutional Internet Banks: Best Investment Management Services, Best Online Cash Management, Best Information Security Initiatives, Best in Mobile Banking, Best in Social Media and, for the third consecutive year, Best Web Site Design.
tag-5: Citi also won the award for Best Corporate/Institutional Internet Banks in the following countries: Argentina, Brazil, Colombia, Costa Rica, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, El Salvador, Guatemala, Haiti, Honduras, Jamaica, Panama, Paraguay, Peru, Trinidad & Tobago, Uruguay and Venezuela.
tag-6: "Citi's continued recognition in these prestigious awards, both at the regional and country levels, distinguish our sustained efforts to deliver the best solutions to our clients. We are very proud of these recognitions and continue committed to bringing the best corporate and institutional internet capabilities to our clients in the region," said Francisco Aristeguieta, head of Global Transaction Services in Latin America and Mexico.
tag-7: One of Citi's major brand names in Mexico, Banamex, was also amongst the distinguished winners this year. Banamex was awarded Best Corporate/Institutional Internet Bank in Mexico, as well as Best Trade Finance Services and Best Integrated Corporate Bank Site, in the regional sub- category of Best Corporate/Institutional Internet Banks.
tag-8: According to Global Finance, winners were chosen among entries evaluated by a world-class panel of judges at Infosys. Global Finance editors were responsible for the final selection of winners in this first round. Winning banks were selected based on the following criteria: strength of strategy for attracting and servicing online customers, success in getting clients to use web offerings, growth of online customers, breadth of product offerings, evidence of tangible benefits gained from internet initiatives, and web site design and functionality. Category winners, such as Best Online Cash Management were selected based on the relative strength and success of their web products and services.
tag-9: Details on all first round winners will be published in the September issue or to read more visit the Global Finance website at http://www.gfmag.com/tools/best-banks/11329-worlds-best-internet-banks-in-latin-america-2011.html.
